intro.heading: What We Offer
intro.description: If you are seeking asylum in Sweden, understanding the legal process and meeting requirements can be overwhelming. At Sweden Relocators, our team of experienced immigration specialists is here to guide you through each stage of the asylum process at the Swedish Migration Agency, ensuring that your case is handled with the utmost care and professionalism.

whyChooseExpert.heading: Why Choose an Expert?
whyChooseExpert.description: Navigating the asylum process in Sweden can be complex, with specific rules and timelines. Here's how our expert team can make a difference for you:

benefits.title: Peace of Mind
benefits.description: With our professional team managing your case, you can focus on other aspects of settling into Sweden. We are committed to ensuring your asylum application is handled effectively and with compassion.

benefits.title: Clear and Transparent Guidance
benefits.description: Our specialists simplify complex legal requirements, ensuring you understand every step. No matter how complicated your case may seem, our team is prepared to help you clarify and effectively present your grounds for asylum.

benefits.title: Immediate Access to a Legal Expert
benefits.description: Our immigration lawyers will begin working on your case as soon as you reach out, providing an immediate response to your concerns and ensuring that your case is prioritized and processed swiftly.

whoCanApply.heading: Who Can Apply for Asylum?
whoCanApply.intro: To apply for asylum in Sweden, you must be physically present within the country or at its border. It is not possible to apply from another country or at a Swedish embassy abroad.
whoCanApply.description: Every asylum seeker's case is reviewed individually, with the Swedish Migration Agency granting a residence permit only if the applicant meets the criteria to be considered a refugee under both Swedish law and the United Nations Refugee Convention.

refugeeDefinition.heading: Refugee Definition and Criteria
refugeeDefinition.intro: Under Swedish law and international guidelines, a person qualifies as a refugee if they face persecution or severe threats in their home country based on:
criteria: Membership in a Particular Social Group
refugeeDefinition.additionalInfo: If groups or individuals in your home country threaten you or your loved ones, this can impact your application. However, a positive decision requires clear evidence of persecution related to one of these factors. During the application process, you will be asked to describe the risks you face if you were to return to your country.
refugeeDefinition.outcome: If your case is accepted, you may receive a residence permit valid for either three years or 13 months, depending on the specifics of your situation.

applicationProcess.heading: Steps to Apply for Asylum in Sweden

steps.title: Physical Presence Required
steps.description: You must be physically in Sweden or at the Swedish border to apply for asylum.

steps.title: Initial Meeting at Migration Agency
steps.description: Once you submit your application, you will be invited to an initial meeting at the Swedish Migration Agency. During this meeting, you will have the opportunity to select your legal representative or lawyer. At this stage, you can choose our experienced team to support you.

steps.title: Legal Representation and Case Preparation
steps.description: If you select us as your representative, we will be contacted by the Migration Agency to assist with your case. Our team will schedule a call with you to gather details about your background and reasons for seeking asylum. We will also prepare you for future interviews and document submissions.

legalRepresentative.heading: Our Role as Your Legal Representative
legalRepresentative.intro: As your legal representative, we will:
services: Provide ongoing support and legal advice throughout the asylum process.
Help clarify your grounds for asylum to the Migration Agency, drawing upon our deep knowledge of Swedish asylum law.
Ensure that your rights are protected, especially since asylum seekers are not expected to be familiar with Swedish legal processes.
Help you navigate appeals if your initial application is denied. We can assist in appealing to both the Migration Court and the Migration Court of Appeal if needed.
legalRepresentative.additionalSupport: In addition, we provide comprehensive relocation services to help you reunite with family members if your application is successful.

familyReunification.heading: Family Reunification for Refugees
familyReunification.description: Sweden recognizes family reunification as an essential right, allowing family members to join refugees or individuals with specific residence permits. If you have been granted asylum or another type of eligible residence permit, your family may be able to join you in Sweden.

whoCanApply.heading: Who Can Qualify for Family Reunification?
whoCanApply.intro: Your family may be eligible to apply for a residence permit to join you in Sweden if you hold:
eligibilityTypes: A temporary residence permit as a refugee, with reasonable chances of a long-term extension
A temporary residence permit based on impediments to return or distressing circumstances, with the likelihood of obtaining a long-term extension

euEeaCitizens.heading: For EU/EEA Citizens
euEeaCitizens.description: If you are an EU/EEA citizen or related to one, you may benefit from a simplified process to bring family members to Sweden based on the right of free movement within Europe. This facilitated visa process can enable family members to travel with you or join you in Sweden.

temporaryPermit.heading: If You Hold a Temporary Residence Permit
temporaryPermit.description: For family reunification applications to be successful, you must hold a valid residence permit at the time of application. If your permit is under extension, the Swedish Migration Agency will first assess your eligibility to maintain residency before deciding on family reunification.
temporaryPermit.familyMembers: Generally, immediate family members such as your spouse, registered partner, cohabiting partner, or children under 18 are eligible to join you. In exceptional cases, other relatives may also qualify, but only under certain conditions.
temporaryPermit.maintenance: A maintenance requirement applies, meaning you must demonstrate that you can financially support your family members and provide suitable housing that meets Swedish standards.
